```{r setup, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Load required museum
library(osmdata)
library(sf)
library(dplyr)
library(leaflet)
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r get boundary shape and box}
## create rectangular boundary box based on barcelona districts polygon
barcelona_bbox <- st_bbox(barcelona_districts)

## visual check if bounding box and actual shape overlap
# Bounding Box as Polygon (as required by ggplot)
bbox_polygon <- st_as_sfc(barcelona_bbox)

# Plot 
ggplot() +
  # Bounding Box as red dashed rectangular
  geom_sf(data = bbox_polygon, 
          color = "red", 
          fill = "transparent", 
          linewidth = 2,
          linetype = "dashed") +
  # barcelona districts as blue polygons
  geom_sf(data = barcelona_districts, 
          color = "blue", 
          fill = "lightblue", 
          alpha = 0.5,
          linewidth = 0.8) +
  # Title 
  ggtitle("barcelona Districts (blue) and OpenStreetMap Bounding Box (red)") +
   # Show coordinates
  coord_sf(crs = st_crs(barcelona_districts)) +
  # Design
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 14, hjust = 0.5),
    plot.caption = element_text(size = 10, hjust = 0.5),
    axis.text = element_text(size = 8)
  )
```

```{r get-osm-data}
# Get OSM library data within barcelona bbox
barcelona_museum_query <- opq(bbox = barcelona_bbox) %>%
  add_osm_feature(key = "tourism", value = "museum") %>%
  osmdata_sf()

# Extract points and polygons
museum_points <- barcelona_museum_query$osm_points
museum_polygons <- barcelona_museum_query$osm_polygons

# Check what columns are available (for debugging)
if (!is.null(museum_points) && nrow(museum_points) > 0) {
  cat("Available columns in museum_points:\n")
  print(names(museum_points))
}

if (!is.null(museum_polygons) && nrow(museum_polygons) > 0) {
  cat("Available columns in museum_polygons:\n")
  print(names(museum_polygons))
}
```

```{r process-points}
# Process museum points if they exist
if (!is.null(museum_points) && nrow(museum_points) > 0) {
  # Include all museums that intersect with districts
    museum_points_filtered <- museum_points %>%
      st_intersection(barcelona_districts)
  
  # Select only columns that exist
  available_cols <- intersect(c("osm_id", "name", "tourism", "operator.type", "operator", 
                                "addr.postcode", "website", "opening_hours", "geometry"),
                              names(museum_points_filtered))
  
  museum_points_clean <- museum_points_filtered %>%
    select(all_of(available_cols)) %>%
    mutate(museum_type = "point")
} else {
  museum_points_clean <- sf::st_sf(data.frame(), crs = st_crs(barcelona_districts))
}
```

```{r process-polygons}
# Process museum polygons if they exist - convert to centroids
if (!is.null(museum_polygons) && nrow(museum_polygons) > 0) {
    # Include all museums that intersect with barcelona districts
    museum_polygons_filtered <- museum_polygons %>%
      st_intersection(barcelona_districts)
  
  # Select only columns that exist
  available_cols <- intersect(c("osm_id", "name", "tourism", "operator.type", "operator", 
                                "addr.postcode", "website", "opening_hours", "geometry"),
                              names(museum_polygons_filtered))
  
  museum_polygons_clean <- museum_polygons_filtered %>%
    select(all_of(available_cols)) %>%
    st_centroid() %>%
    mutate(museum_type = "polygon_centroid")
} else {
  museum_polygons_clean <- sf::st_sf(data.frame(), crs = st_crs(barcelona_districts))
}
```

```{r combine-and-deduplicate}
# Combine points and polygons if both exist
if (nrow(museum_points_clean) > 0 && nrow(museum_polygons_clean) > 0) {
  # Ensure both have same columns
  common_cols <- intersect(names(museum_points_clean), names(museum_polygons_clean))
  
  barcelona_museum <- bind_rows(
    museum_points_clean[common_cols],
    museum_polygons_clean[common_cols]
  )
} else if (nrow(museum_points_clean) > 0) {
  barcelona_museum <- museum_points_clean
} else if (nrow(museum_polygons_clean) > 0) {
  barcelona_museum <- museum_polygons_clean
} else {
  barcelona_museum <- sf::st_sf(data.frame(), crs = st_crs(barcelona_districts))
}
```

```{r remove-duplicates}
# Remove museums that are very close to each other (within 100 meters)
# First filter out NA names, then apply proximity filtering
if (nrow(barcelona_museum) > 0) {
  # First step: Remove rows where name is NA
  barcelona_museum_no_na <- barcelona_museum %>%
    filter(!is.na(name))
  
  # Check if we still have data after NA filtering
  if (nrow(barcelona_museum_no_na) > 0) {
    # All geometries are now points, so we can directly calculate distances
    # Create distance matrix
    dist_matrix <- st_distance(barcelona_museum_no_na)
    
    # Find museums within 100m of each other
    close_pairs <- which(dist_matrix < units::set_units(100, "m") & 
                           upper.tri(dist_matrix, diag = FALSE), arr.ind = TRUE)
    
    # If there are close pairs, keep only one from each pair
    if (nrow(close_pairs) > 0) {
      # Keep the first museum from each close pair
      to_remove <- unique(close_pairs[,2])
      barcelona_museum_final <- barcelona_museum_no_na[-to_remove, ]
    } else {
      barcelona_museum_final <- barcelona_museum_no_na
    }
  } else {
    # No data left after NA filtering - create empty sf object
    barcelona_museum_final <- st_sf(
      geometry = st_sfc(crs = st_crs(barcelona_districts))
    )
  }
} else {
  # No initial data - create empty sf object
  barcelona_museum_final <- st_sf(
    geometry = st_sfc(crs = st_crs(barcelona_districts))
  )
}
```

```{r display-results}
# Display the first few museum with key information
if (nrow(barcelona_museum_final) > 0) {
  # Select only columns that exist
  display_cols <- intersect(c("osm_id", "name", "tourism", "operator", "operator.type", 
                              "addr.postcode", "website", "opening_hours", "museum_type"),
                            names(barcelona_museum_final))
  
  barcelona_museum_display <- barcelona_museum_final %>%
    st_drop_geometry() %>%
    select(all_of(display_cols)) %>%
    head(10)
  
  print(barcelona_museum_display)
}
```

```{r create-map, fig.width=10, fig.height=8}
# Create a simple map of the museum (all are now points)
if (nrow(barcelona_museum_final) > 0) {
  # Transform to WGS84 for leaflet
  museum_wgs84 <- st_transform(barcelona_museum_final, 4326)
  
  # Create different colors for original points vs polygon centroids
  colors <- ifelse(museum_wgs84$museum_type == "point", "blue", "red")
  
  # Create map
  museum_map <- leaflet(museum_wgs84) %>%
    addTiles() %>%
    addCircleMarkers(
      color = colors,
      radius = 6,
      popup = ~paste0(
        "<b>", ifelse(is.na(name), "Unnamed museum", name), "</b><br>",
        "Type: ", museum_type, "<br>",
        "Operator: ", ifelse(is.na(operator), "Unknown", operator), "<br>",
        "Address: ", 
        if("addr:street" %in% names(museum_wgs84)) {
          ifelse(is.na(`addr:street`), "", 
                 paste(`addr:street`, 
                       ifelse("addr:housenumber" %in% names(museum_wgs84) & !is.na(`addr:housenumber`), 
                              `addr:housenumber`, ""), sep = " "))
        } else {
          "No address info"
        }
      )
    ) %>%
    addLegend(
      "bottomright",
      colors = c("blue", "red"),
      labels = c("Original Point", "Polygon Centroid"),
      title = "Museum Type"
    )
  
  museum_map
}
```

```{r save-data}
# Save the final dataset
if (nrow(barcelona_museum_final) > 0) {
  
  # Create CSV with specific columns including x,y coordinates
  barcelona_museum_table <- barcelona_museum_final %>%
    # Extract coordinates
    mutate(
      x = st_coordinates(.)[,1],
      y = st_coordinates(.)[,2]
    ) %>%
    st_drop_geometry() %>%
    # Select only the requested columns
    select(osm_id, name, tourism, operator, addr.postcode, x, y)
  
  write.csv(barcelona_museum_table, "Data/potential cooling centres/barcelona_museum.csv", row.names = FALSE)
  
  cat("Data saved as barcelona_museum.rds and barcelona_museum.csv\n")
  cat("CSV contains columns: osm_id, name, tourism, operator, addr.postcode, x, y\n")
}
```
